locations.name: Eiffel Tower
locations.description: A global cultural icon of France and one of the most recognizable structures in the world.

locations.name: Statue of Liberty
locations.description: A colossal neoclassical sculpture on Liberty Island in New York Harbor within New York City.

locations.name: Big Ben
locations.description: The nickname for the Great Bell of the clock at the north end of the Palace of Westminster in London.

locations.name: Taj Mahal
locations.description: An ivory-white marble mausoleum on the right bank of the Yamuna river in the Indian city of Agra.

locations.name: Tokyo Tower
locations.description: A communications and observation tower in the Shiba-koen district of Minato, Tokyo, Japan.

locations.name: Kremlin
locations.description: The Kremlin is a fortified complex in the center of Moscow.

locations.name: Angkor Wat
locations.description: A temple complex in Cambodia and the largest religious monument in the world.

locations.name: Christ the Redeemer
locations.description: An Art Deco statue of Jesus Christ in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil.

locations.name: Petra
locations.description: A historical and archaeological city in southern Jordan.

locations.name: Great Pyramid of Giza
locations.description: The oldest and largest of the three pyramids in the Giza pyramid complex.

locations.name: Chichen Itza
locations.description: A large pre-Columbian city built by the Maya people of the Terminal Classic period.

locations.name: Colosseum
locations.description: An oval amphitheatre in the centre of the city of Rome, Italy.

locations.name: Machu Picchu
locations.description: A 15th-century Inca citadel located in the Eastern Cordillera of southern Peru.

locations.name: Santorini
locations.description: An island in the southern Aegean Sea, about 200 km (120 mi) southeast of Greece's mainland.

locations.name: Uluru
locations.description: A large sandstone rock formation in the southern part of the Northern Territory, central Australia.

locations.name: Florence Cathedral
locations.description: The cathedral of Florence, Italy, begun in 1296 in the Gothic style to a design of Arnolfo di Cambio.

locations.name: Pantheon
locations.description: A former Roman temple, now a Catholic church, in Rome, Italy.

locations.name: Piazza Navona
locations.description: A square in Rome, Italy. It is built on the site of the Stadium of Domitian, built in the 1st century AD.

locations.name: Roman Forum
locations.description: A rectangular forum surrounded by the ruins of several important ancient government buildings at the center of the city of Rome.

locations.name: Louvre Museum
locations.description: The world's largest art museum and a historic monument in Paris, France.

locations.name: Stonehenge
locations.description: A prehistoric monument in Wiltshire, England.
